body:

replies.body:
*cough* yorick*cough*

I'm pretty sure i saw some ware that cyber katarina was in the development a few years ago and got scrapped so its probably a cannibalized version of that.

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/07/712-pbe-update.html - they look pretty cool

Look at it this way, while they cater for champions that heaven't had recent skins where they can, or prioritise a second skin for a new champion, past that the release schedule is dictated by when the viable ideas are had, and how quickly they move through the approval phases.

The fact is it's a creative process, so cannot be wholly prioritised by x champion hasn't had a skin in the longest.

It's all well and good to say x needs a new skin, but in the time it takes to develop a new skin for x, why would you throw away a cool skin for y and z?

This isn't a case of "we'll replace Project Kat with x" but a case of "we'll give them Project Kat as well" i.e it'd be Kat getting a skin or noone getting a skin, because unfortunately ideas don't grow on trees, and ideas that make it through the approval process are even rarer. 

Remember that to make it to development the skin concepts have to meet all the standards the skin teams set for themselves. To force a skin that doesn't meet all those standards through just because it's for a champ with less skins would really only mean an overall reduction in skin quality, something I doubt any of us want.
